snippet: Days after protesters brawled with politicians loyal to President Mikheil Saakashvili, the country’s interior minister said that Mr. Saakashvili had “artificially provoked” the episode.
abstract: Georgian Interior Min Irakli Gharibashvili accuses Pres Mikheil Saakashvili of provoking brawl between protesters and politicians loyal to him to win sympathy of Western governments.

byline.contributor: Ellen Barry contributed reporting from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: Days after protesters brawled with politicians loyal to President Mikheil Saakashvili, the country’s interior minister said that Mr. Saakashvili had “artificially provoked” the episode.

headline.seo: Georgian Official Accuses President of Provoking Violence
headline.main: Georgian Official Accuses President of Provoking Violence
headline.print_headline: Georgia: Official Accuses President of Provoking Brawl
